alert.note: Alert for Peoria; Tazewell; Woodford (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 27 at 8:16PM CST until further notice by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois... Illinois River at Henry affecting Marshall and Putnam Counties. Illinois River near Havana affecting Cass, Mason and Fulton Counties. Illinois River at Beardstown affecting Cass, Brown, Morgan and Schuyler Counties. Illinois River at Peoria affecting Woodford, Peoria and Tazewell Counties. .The following forecasts are based on observed precipitation, soil moisture conditions, and forecast precipitation. Ice is moving through the channel so fluctuations in the reading and forecast are possible. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Illinois River at Peoria. * WHEN...From Sunday evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 17.5 feet, Water approaches Spring Bay Park. At 18.0 feet, Some flooding begins to bottomland not protected by levees. At 22.7 feet, Flooding begins to low lying areas in Peoria Heights and Peoria`s Riverfront Park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CST Saturday the stage was 15.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow evening and continue rising to a crest of 21.5 feet Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Illinois River Peoria 18.0 15.3 Sat 7 pm CST 17.5 19.5 20.7 &&
info.instruction: Persons with interests along this river need to remain aware of the latest forecasts and associated flood risk for their area. Stay tuned for further updates on this flooding situation. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
